title: Bug 32286: ControlExample Button Tab changing styles resets button orientation
description: Bug 32286: When using the Button controls from the SWT Controls example, if SWT.ARROW buttons are used and the SWT.BORDER property is selected or deselected, the arrow alignment property of all the arrow buttons is reset to UP.
OB: The button orientation should not be reset when changing the SWT.BORDER property.
EB: The arrow button orientation is reset to UP after changing the SWT.BORDER property.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Install the M5 example plugins.
2. Start Eclipse.
3. Go to Window -> Show View -> Other and select SWT Controls under SWT Examples. Expand the new view if necessary, and click on the button tab.
4. On the right pane, select 'SWT.ARROW' in the styles group.
5. Select an alignment other than 'up' from the alignment group.
6. Select a new orientation for the arrows.
7. (De)select SWT.BORDER again.
8. Note that the arrow orientation is reset to 'up'.

Observed in:
- OS: HPUX 11.11
- Eclipse: V2.1 Build Id: 200302061700 (M5), with M5 example plugins.
